summary:
I am a senior exploration geologist with experience on integrated studies from regional to prospect scale. Experience covers various oil and gas provinces such as North Sea, Norwegian and Russian Barents Sea, Timan Pechora, Malaysia and Bahrain. 

KEY SKILLS

•  Play Based Exploration 
•  Sedimentology: Facies analyses of clastics and carbonates
•  Stratigraphy: Well correlation and well data analyses 
•  Seismic interpretation of 3D and 2D seismic datasets

school.name: International Institute for Aerospace Survey and Earth Sciences

profile_positions.description:
• Regional Play Based Exploration of the Norwegian and Russian Barents Sea. Integrated play based exploration study at a basin scale. Identification of plays and risk assessment. Well/dry hole analysis, core description and sampling, facies mapping and identification of prospective areas.

•  Geologist for an exploration well for a Permian prospect, offshore Germany
-      Well proposal and well planning 
-      Prospect interpretation and structure evaluation
-      Geological support during drilling 
-      Post-well assessment

• Farm-in opportunity evaluation of a field in the Pechora Sea, Russia. 
•	License application for the Norwegian 22nd round. Contributed to writing the geology
profile_positions.title: Senior Geologist

profile_positions.description:
•  Regional 2D seismic interpretation of the Norwegian Barents Sea. (Fugro Multiclient, Norway)
•  Detailed seismic mapping over two shallow gas fields in the northern sector of the Dutch North Sea in order to improve field development plans for these assets. The gas occurrences are related to gas escapement routes along salt domes and subsequent accumulation in unconsolidated Pliocene-Pleistocene deltaic sediments. (Chevron)
•  Manual and automated mapping of faults on a 3D seismic volume using Petrel’s advanced ANT module (automated structural interpretation) to improve reservoir characterization.
•  Interpreted 3D seismic data of a Rotliegend prospect in the North Sea.
•  Correlated wells in the North Sea as part of a unitization project. (Positive result for client)
•  Interpreted 3D seismic data of a Permian prospect in the Bahrain Field. Work also included well correlation and estimating the volume of gas in place. 
•  Seismic interpretation of Mako Trough in Hungary for shale gas. Carried out data loading, horizon mapping and time-depth conversion.
• Workstation database management. Loading of seismic, well and log data (LAS/LIS/ Ascii) and images into Kingdom, Petrel and GIS projects.
• Mapping of surface subsidence due to gas extraction.
profile_positions.title: Geologist

profile_positions.description: Risk assessment and evaluation of potentially contaminated land using soil reports and historical records. Data interpretation/integration and entry in a geographic information system (GIS) in order to attain a countrywide database of soil cover. Emphasis is on determining which products pollute soil and groundwater as a result of man-made activities.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Carbonate Development team:
Seismic interpretation of a Miocene reef complex in the South China Sea. Interpretation of offshore 3-dimensional seismic dataset over an existing and a potential gas field which is a vital part of an integrated study for the Shell operating unit in Sarawak, designed to result in a development plan for the potential field.
Objective: To better understand the causes of the poor-quality seismic data over the potential gas fields
•  Horizon picking and mapping using Seisworks
•  Generate synthetic seismic traces

Reservoir Geology team:
Forward seismic modeling using outcrop analogues to evaluate the level of reservoir architecture that can be extracted from seismic datasets that are regularly used to constrain 3-dimensional reservoir models.
Objective: Investigated at which seismic frequencies various scales of stratal geometries, facies variability and rock properties (water-filled or gas-filled) can be imaged.
•  Created synthetic seismic models of a mixed aeolian, sabkha to playa lake succession as might be found in the Rotliegend reservoir of the Southern North Sea using an analogous outcrop from Schnebly Hill Formation, Arizona, USA. Results are reported via internal web-based knowledge management systems to optimize access throughout the Shell Group.
•  Generated synthetic seismic models of a deltaic to shallow marine succession from the Book Cliffs Formation, Utah, USA. This setting is an excellent analogue for the Jurassic Brent Group of the North Sea and the Nigerian delta.
